summary: marine invertebrates represent a very important source of bioactive molecules. bis-indole alkaloids constitute a class of deep-sea sponge metabolites with potent antiinflammatory, antimicrobial, antiviral and antitumor biological activity. the first isolated four dragmacidins 1, containing the six membered piperazine heterocyclic ring, were isolated from a large number of deep water sponges. compounds 4b and 4c exhibited antiproliferative activity against human broncopulmonary cancer cells (NSCLC-N6) with IC50 values of 12.0 and 6.3 g/mL, respectively. bis-indolyl thiophene [20] 5, pyrazoles [21] 6, furans [22] 7 and isoxazoles [22] 8 showed inhibitory activity against a wide range of human tumor cell lines. ethyl 1-[(tert-butoxycarbonyl)amino]-2-methyl-5-(1-methyl-1H-indol-3-yl)carbonyl)-4-[(1-methyl-1H-indol-3-yl)carbonyl]-1H-pyrrole-3-carboxylates derivatives 10a–e are the -diketones 12a–e prepared in good yields (45–70%) from N- four pyrrole derivatives 10a,c–e were selected for a single dose concentration, in vitro disease-oriented antitumor screenings against the full NCI panel. the results showed a growth of 27.31% against the SNB-75 cell line of the CNS cancer sub-panel and 4.73% against the HOP-92 of the non-small cell lung cancer sub-panel. 1,2-Diaza-1,3-diene (DD, 13) was synthesized as a mixture of E/Z isomers. chromatography was performed with a Büchi Sepacor chromatography module. compounds were visualized by exposure to UV light and by dipping plates in 1% Ce(SO4)4H2O, 2.5% (NH4)6Mo7O244H2O in 10% sulfuric acid followed by heating on a hot plate. a solution of malonyl dichloride (1 mL, 10 mmol) in DCM (10 mL) was added dropwise to a cold solution of the appropriate N-methylindole 11a–e (20 mmol) the reaction mixture was stirred for 2 h at room temperature. the mixture was then added to 5% aqueous sodium carbonate and shaken for 2 min. the crude mixture was concentrated under reduced pressure and the products 10a–e were purified by column chromatography on silica gel. the crude mixture was concentrated under reduced pressure and the products 10a–e were the assay is terminated by the addition of cold TCA. cells are fixed in situ by the gentle addition of 50 L of cold 50% (w/v) TCA. the supernatant is discarded, and the plates are washed five times with tap water and air dried. cells are inoculated into 96 well microtiter plates in 100 L at plating densities ranging from 5,000 to 40,000 cells/well. cells are fixed in situ by the gentle addition of 50 L of cold 50% (w/v) TCA (final concentration, 10% TCA) and incubated for 60 min at 4 °C. plates are washed five times with tap water and air dried. unbound dye is removed by washing five times with 1% acetic acid. plates are incubated for 10 min at room temperature. compounds showed moderate activity against two cell lines belonging to the NCI CNS and non-small cell lung cancer sub-panels.
